title: K-12 Gamification-Based e-Learning Usability Improvement Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and experience using e-learning platforms
context.additional_context: An e-learning platform improvement project applying gamification elements for students/job seekers with intermediate expertise in social studies

learning_goals: Design three or more e-learning scenarios incorporating gamification elements (game mechanics, motivation systems).
Develop and apply an e-learning usability evaluation tool through project-based collaboration.

Learners analyze learning motivation and engagement metrics (e.g., 80% attendance rate, 70-point quiz average, 4/5 survey satisfaction) of a corporate education program for teenagers and write a 5-page report including three data-driven improvement strategies.

Within four weeks, learners design one gamification prototype (Lo-fi/Hi-fi) in digital device environments (tablets/smartphones). They reflect feedback from peer reviews and user testing (5+ participants) to improve at least two of three functionality items in the prototype.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
